segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 1

segments.pli: 3. Akammaniyavagga
segments.en: 3. Useless

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ akammaniyaṃ hoti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed like this, is as useless as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ akammaniyaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: An undeveloped mind is useless.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ kammaniyaṃ hoti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed like this, is as workable as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ kammaniyaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: A developed mind is workable.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed like this, is so very harmful as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
segments.en: An undeveloped mind is very harmful.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed like this, is so very beneficial as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
segments.en: A developed mind is very beneficial.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ apātubhūtaṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed, with such untapped potential, is so very harmful as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ apātubhūtaṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
segments.en: An undeveloped mind, with untapped potential, is very harmful.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ pātubhūtaṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed, with its potential realized, is so very beneficial as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ pātubhūtaṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
segments.en: A developed mind, with its potential realized, is very beneficial.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ abahulīkataṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed and cultivated, is so very harmful as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ abahulīkataṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
segments.en: An undeveloped and uncultivated mind is very harmful.”

segments.pli: Sattamaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed and cultivated, is so very beneficial as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
segments.en: A developed and cultivated mind is very beneficial.”

segments.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ abahulīkataṃ dukkhādhivahaṃ hoti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed and cultivated, brings such suffering as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ abahulīkataṃ dukkhādhivahaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: An undeveloped and uncultivated mind brings suffering.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.
“Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ sukhādhivahaṃ hoti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed and cultivated, brings such happiness as the mind.

segments.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ sukhādhivahaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: A developed and cultivated mind brings happiness.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Akammaniyavaggo tatiyo.
